qas.question: During what ceremony were shots fired at the Queen?
Who was the assailant who shot at Queen Elizabeth?
Which of Elizabeth's sons served in the Falklands War?
Who was the intruder Elizabeth awoke to find in her bedroom?
In what year did Ronald Reagan order the invasion of Grenada?
In what month in 1982 did Ronald Reagan visit Windsor Castle?
In what month in 1983 did Elizabeth visit Reagan's California ranch?
What was Elizabeth's horses name in 1983?
How many years did Michael Fagan serve for breaking into Buckingham Palace?

context: During the 1981 <a0_0>Trooping the Colour<a0_0/> ceremony and only six weeks before the wedding of Charles, Prince of Wales, and Lady Diana Spencer, six shots were fired at the Queen from close range as she rode down The Mall on her horse, <b8_0>Burmese<b8_0/>. Police later discovered that the shots were blanks. The 17-year-old assailant, <a1_0>Marcus Sarjeant<a1_0/>, was sentenced to five years in prison and released after <b9_0>three<b9_0/>. The Queen's composure and skill in controlling her mount were widely praised. From <b7_0>April<b7_0/> to September 1982, the Queen remained anxious but proud of her son, <a2_0>Prince Andrew<a2_0/>, who was serving with British forces during the Falklands War. On 9 <b6_0>July<b6_0/>, the Queen awoke in her bedroom at Buckingham Palace to find an intruder, <a3_0>Michael Fagan<a3_0/>, in the room with her. Remaining calm and through two calls to the Palace police switchboard, she spoke to Fagan while he sat at the foot of her bed until assistance arrived seven minutes later. Though she hosted US President Ronald Reagan at Windsor Castle in 1982 and visited his Californian ranch in <b5_0>1983<b5_0/>, she was angered when his administration ordered the invasion of <a4_0>Grenada<a4_0/>, one of her Caribbean realms, without informing her.
